Amendment Director Qualification Code: During such time as there is an Acquiring Person a majority of "continuing," "disinterested" or "independent" directors is required to amend the rights. To qualify, directors most commonly must not be affiliates of t

Amendment Director Qualification Code: During such time as there is an Acquiring Person a majority of "continuing," "disinterested" or "independent" directors is required to amend the rights. To qualify, directors most commonly must not be affiliates of t

During such time as there is an Acquiring Person, a majority of the qualified directors is required to redeem the rights. To qualify, directors most commonly must not be affiliates of the Acquiring Person and/or must have served a minimum term.

During such time as there is an Acquiring Person, a majority of the qualified directors is required to redeem the rights. To qualify, directors most commonly must not be affiliates of the Acquiring Person and/or must have served a minimum term.

During such time as there is an Acquiring Person, a majority of the qualified directors is required to redeem the rights. To qualify, directors most commonly must not be affiliates of the Acquiring Person and/or must have served a minimum term.
Percent at which an acquiring stockholder is deemed to be an ‘Acquiring Person.' This is most often the same as the % TO SEPARATE and the FLIP IN %.
Acquiring person's stake after flip-in, stated as a percent.
The minimum level of ownership at which a person can be declared an adverse person.

Percentage at which rights will flip-in if, during such time as there is an Acquiring Person, there shall be a reduction (or failure to increase to reflect reclassification) in the annual rate of dividends except for valid business reasons. Most commonly,
Percentage (usually 50%) of beneficial share ownership at which the rights entitle holders to purchase shares of the acquiring company at a bargain purchase price
The minimum percentage to which thresholds may be reduced under a limited threshold reduction provision
Minimum of all discretionary flip-in trigger percentages (i.e. adverse person, modified adverse person, passive increase, self-dealing and dividend failure trigger percentages)

Minimum of all status and discretionary flip-in trigger percentages (i.e. status flip-in, adverse person, modified adverse person, passive increase, self-dealing and dividend failure trigger percentages).
Passive Increase Cap, stated as a percent

Percentage of a company’s common stock that a recapitalizing acquirer must hold in order for the rights to flip in. (e.g. if the acquiring percent is 20% and any acquiring person engineered a recapitalization that raised the stake by 1% or more would set

i.l: Percent To Separate Upon Share Acquisition
i.d: Percentage acquisition of the company’s common stock by a person other than the company or another entity at which the rights will separate from the common shares and become exercisable to buy the ‘securities that the warrant will purchase’

i.l: Percent to Separate Upon Tender Offer
i.d: Percentage acquisition declared as the goal of the tender offer for the company’s common stock. (i.e. if a tender offer is launched for this % of common stock of the issuing company, then the rights will separate.

i.l: Projected Percent Change in Value of Acquiring Person's Shares
i.d: Projected Percent Change in Value of Acquiring Person's Shares

i.l: Projected Percent Change in Value of Public Shares After Flip-In
i.d: Projected Percent Change in Value of Public Shares After Flip-In
Public Stake After Flip In
Percentage threshold of beneficial ownership at which the rights will flip-in if the Acquiring Person engages in certain self-dealing transactions as defined in the rights agreement.
Maximum percentage of beneficial ownership which may be held by a “qualified offeror” in order to qualify under the shareholder referendum option

Percentage of beneficial ownership of the issuer at which the rights will 'flip-in' (e.g. become rights to purchase common shares or in some cases, purchase notes or receive cash) at a significant discount to the market price (most commonly .50). The "sta
Percentage below which the Acquiring Person must reduce his/her ownership in order to reinstate the board’s right to redeem the rights after the close of the redemption window.
Duration of Plan in Years

Multiple of the market value that the company’s share must be purchased for upon the status flip in % being reached. It is almost always .5 (i.e. the shares can be purchased for 50% of their market value)

i.l: Number Of Shares Puchaseable Per Right
i.d: Number Of Shares Puchaseable Per Right

i.l: Projected New Shares Issued as Result of Flip-In
i.d: Projected New Shares Issued as Result of Flip-In

i.l: Amendment Number Of The Rights Agreement
i.d: Number of Amendments to Rights Agreement: If the record is an amendment, the number of the amendment to rights agreement. Amendments that amend SEC filings but do not impact the provisions of the rights plan (e.g. make corrections to Item 1 of the 8-A) ar
Number of issuers primary shares outstanding, not including options, warrants, and convertibles.

i.l: Issuer Fully Diluted Common Shares Outstanding
i.d: Fully-diluted common shares outstanding of the company issuing the rights plan

i.l: Number Of Days As Redemption Window
i.d: Redemption Window (Days): The number of days after the stock acquisition date (date on which an Acquiring Person becomes such) during which the rights may be redeemed. In plans with adverse person provisions, rights are usually non-redeemable after a pers
Number of days after an acquisition, that the rights will separate, usually 10

i.l: Number of Shares Equivalent to Acquiring Person Holdings After Flip-In
i.d: Number of Shares Equivalent to Acquiring Person Holdings After Flip-In

i.l: Number of Shares Equivalent to Public Shareholders Holdings
i.d: Number of Shares Equivalent to Public Shareholders Holdings
Unique Deal Identifier, local to the Deals db
Public Shares After Flip-In

i.l: SDC Deal Number Of Most Recent Amendment
i.d: Unique Identifier of the deal which was immediately before this amendment.

i.l: Sdc Deal Number Of Original Plan
i.d: A new plan adopted by a company is an original plan. This field is auto populated. This log number is the first version of the current plan, subsequent amendments will have unique log numbers that will be also be auto-populated. The original log number wi

i.l: Total Authorized Shares of Preferred Stock
i.d: Total authorized shares of the issue of preferred stock that the rights will be exercisable to buy (this field will be available only if the SECUTITY TYPE is ‘P’).

i.l: Total Common Shares Outstanding After FlipIn
i.d: Total Common Shares Outstanding After Flip In

Purchase price for the equivalent of one common share. For example, if the unadjusted exercise price is $150 and the rights are exerciseable for one half share of common stock then the adjusted exercise price is $300 (=150/.5). Any fractional share of pre
Price which must be paid by the issuer as consideration for redeeming the rights before they have expired.

i.l: Market Value of Acquiring Person's Shares on Adoption Date, stated in US$ Millions
i.d: Number of shares held by the Acquiring Person multiplied by the closing market price of the issuer's common shares on the date of the announcement, divided by 1,000,000. Formula: BFASHR x PRDAYOF / 1000000

i.l: Market Value of Public's Shares on Adoption Date
i.d: The product of the number of shares equivalent to the public shareholders' stake and the closing market price of the issuer's common shares on the date of the announcement. Formula: BFPSHR x PRDAYOF
Net Operating Loss, stated in millions; applies to tax benefit plans only.
Value of Shares Exercise

i.l: Projected Value of Acquiring Person's Shares After Flip-In
i.d: Projected Value of Acquiring Person's Shares After Flip-In

i.l: Projected Capital Infusion Resulting from Flip-In
i.d: Projected Capital Infusion Resulting from Flip-In, stated in millions.

i.l: Projected Per Share Dollar Gain to Public Shareholders After Flip-In
i.d: Projected Per Share Dollar Gain to Public Shareholders After Flip-In

i.l: Projected Per Share Dollar Loss to Acquiring Person After Flip-In
i.d: Projected Per Share Dollar Loss to Acquiring Person After Flip-In
Projected Market Capitalization After Flip-In, stated in millions.

i.l: Projected Market Price of Issuer's Common Stock After Flip-In
i.d: Projected Market Price of Issuer's Common After Flip-In

i.l: Projected Value of Public Shares After Flip-In
i.d: Projected Value of Public Shares After Flip-In

i.l: Total Market Value of Issuer's Common Shares on Announcement Date
i.d: The product of the number of common shares outstanding at the time of adoption and the closing market price of the Issuer's common shares on the day of announcement. Formula: PACT x PRDAYOF

Amount that must be spent when the rights become exercisable to exercise them. Purchase price at which the rights entitle the holder to purchase the number of shares as specified in the rights agreement. Prices quoted in foreign currencies are converted t

i.l: Annual General Meeting Month and Day (MMMDD)
i.d: Month and Day on which the Annual Board meeting occurs, in 'MMMDD' format.

i.d: Number of days during which a board comprised of non-qualified directors is prevented from redeeming the pill.

i.l: Has Adverse Person Discretionary Flip-In Trigger
i.d: Yes/No flag set to Y if plan contains an adverse person discretionary flip-in trigger. Should the Board of Directors declare a person to be adverse to the interests of the Company, the rights will be distributed and will flip-in at a threshold lower than

i.l: Has Option To Pay Exercise Price In Common Shares
i.d: Yes/No flag set to Y if the purchase price can be paid in either cash or common stock.

i.l: Has Delayed Redemption Provision For Non Qualified Directors
i.d: Yes/No flag set to Y if the redemption provision prevents a board comprised of non-qualified directors from redeeming the pill for a specified number of days. This is a variation on the Directors qualification provision above

i.l: Has Delay Of Distribution Of Rights
i.d: Yes/No Flag set to Y if the distribution of rights (DAYS) may be delayed at the boards discretion. (e.g. ‘on the close of the tenth business day (or such later date as the board of directors may determine) after an acquiring person acquires more than 20%

Yes/No flag set to Y if the plan provides that the rights will flip-in if, during such time as there is an Acquiring Person, there shall be a reduction in (or a failure to increase to reflect reclassification) the annual rate of dividends except for valid

After a person becomes an “Acquiring Person,” and until the Acquiring Person acquires some specified percentage, the board may exchange the rights for common shares (or in some cases cash, notes or other securities) of the issuer. Rights held by the Acqui

i.l: Has Extension Provision For Redemption Window
i.d: Yes/No set to Y for plans where the board has the express option to extend the redemption window under limited circumstances as defined in the rights agreement.
Yes/No flag set to Y when the issuer has filed for Bankruptcy
Yes/No flag set to Y if plan exempts certain shareholders from the provisions of the plan

i.l: Has Three Year Independent Director Provision
i.d: Yes/No flag set to Y when the Pill has a Three-Year Independent Director Provision. The board will reevaluate the plan every three years. TYDEF is generally available for Poison Pill deals adopted in 1997 and after
Yes/No flag set to Y if there is no Redemption Window and therefore, the rights may continue to be redeemed at any time, even long after an Acquiring Person appears.

Yes/No flag set to Y if the plan contains a provision whereby shareholders who cross the Acquiring Person threshold, due to a reclassification, recapitalization, or repurchase of shares approved by the board, shall not be deemed to be an Acquirin
Yes/No flag set to Y if an M&A transaction is related to the poison pill.

i.l: Has Self Dealing Discretionary Flip In Trigger
i.d: Yes/No flag set to Y if plan contains a self-dealing discretionary flip-in trigger. Rights will be triggered should an Acquiring Person engage in certain self-dealing transactions as defined in the rights agreement. Self-dealing most often includes transf
Yes/No flag set to Y if shareholders can simply vote the pill out of existence at any time

Yes/No flag set to Y if a qualified offeror (owner of less than a specified percentage) who makes a qualified offer (usually an all cash, fully financed tender offer supported by a fairness opinion from a nationally recognized investment bank) has the rig

Yes/No flag set to Y when at the time of the adoption of the Pill the issuer has a corporate board structure where only a portion of the board of directors is elected each year, usually to discourage takeover attempts.

Yes/No flag set to Y when the deal contains flip in triggers only and no discretionary flip in triggers (i.e. adverse person, modified adverse person, passive increase, self-dealing and dividend failure trigger percentages).
Yes/No flag set to Y when the Pill has a provision that allows for shareholder approval of the plan at intervals. SUNSETF is generally available for Poison Pill deals adopted in 1995 and after.
Yes/No flag set to Y if the board’s right to redeem the rights will be reinstated after it has expired (i.e. the redemption window has closed) if the board approves a transaction with a white knight.

Yes/No flag which is set to Y if the plan provides that a person who obtained approval from the board prior to purchasing shares of the company will not be considered an Acquiring Person with respect to those shares. In many cases, the provision expressly

i.l: Has Yo Yo And White Knight Redemption
i.d: Y/N item indicates whether or not plan has both Yo Yo and White Knight redemption provisions.

i.l: Has Yo Yo Redemption For Reduced Ownership
i.d: Yes/No flag set to Y if the board’s right to redeem the rights will be reinstated once it has expired (i.e. the redemption window has closed) if the Acquiring Person reduces his/her ownership to below a specified percentage

Yes/No flag set to Y if a Pill has a provision which calls for a shareholder vote on takeover offers at the bidder's request. If the company receives certain types of all-cash offers the stockholders can vote on the transaction and override the plan.

Yes/No flag set to Y if the Pill prevents Directors elected in any proxy contest, who have not been approved by existing directors, from removing the pill. It is populated for Poison Pill deals adopted after December 31, 1996.
Yes/No flag set to Y when the Duration of the plan is conditional
Y/N set to Y if this is the Issuer's first poison pill plan.

i.l: Is Issuer Provided With Fairness Opinion
i.d: Yes/No flag set to Y if the issuer is provided with a fairness opinion by an investment bank.

Yes/No flag set to Y when the plan is the latest amendment number available. In other words, if there are 3 total amendments and if the deal is amendment number 3, this flag would be set to Y for the third deal.

i.l: Is Limited Threshold Reduction Provision Available
i.d: Yes/No flag which is set to Y if the plan contains an amendment provision whereby prior to the existence of an Acquiring Person, the board may amend the rights plan to lower the flip-in trigger (and associated thresholds) to the greater of (i) one percent

Yes/No flag set to Y when the plan is the original deal of the various amendments available for it. In other words, if there are 3 total amendments and if the deal is amendment number 0, this flag would be set to Y for the original deal.

Yes/No flag which is set to Y if the plan contains a provision whereby shareholders who cross the Acquiring Person threshold due to a recapitalization shall not be deemed to be an Acquiring Person for the purposes of the rights agreement until such person

Yes/No flag set to Y for plans that contain a provision whereby the board may waive application of the plan if the acquirer follows certain fairness procedures and/or is approved by the board of directors. The requirements to qualify as a “permitted offer
Yes/No flag set to Y for new plans that replace previously adopted plans that have been redeemed, expired or invalidated (also referred to as a secondary plan).

i.l: Is Suspended Due To Pending Litigation
i.d: Yes/No flag set to Y if the plan provides that the board may suspend the application of the rights plan (usually for 90 days) while awaiting the outcome of the litigation or statutory challenge to the validity of the rights agreement

Yes/No item set to Y if the plan is a tax benefit preservation plan. A tax benefit preservation plan aims to protect the issuer's net operating loss carry forwards, as opposed to a traditional rights plan, which is designed to prevent hostile takeovers.

Yes/No flag set to Y if a plan provides that if the board determines that a person crossed the Acquiring Person threshold inadvertently, and such person divests those shares, he/she will not be considered an Acquiring Person.
Date on which the issuer had filed for Bankruptcy

i.l: Date of Adoption of Most Current Plan
i.d: Date of Adoption of Most Current Plan

i.l: Date Of Announcement Of Plan Adoption
i.d: Date Of Announcement Of Plan Adoption
Date Of Earliest Plan Adopted
Date that Form 8-A was received by the SEC. Form 8-A (Registration Statement) reports the adoption of the rights plan.
Date that Form 8-A-A was received by the SEC. Form 8-A-A is the amendment to filing that reports the adoption of the amendment to the rights plan.
Date that Form 8-K was received by the SEC. Form 8-K (Current Report) reports the adoption or amendment of the rights plan.
Date when Deal Was Last Amendmed
Net Operating Date; applies to tax benefit plans only.
Date When issuer's board approved the distribution of the rights of the dividend.

Date on which the rights agreement ceases to be in force. If the expiration date varies based upon the occurrence of certain contingencies, the earliest date on which the rights may expire is contained in this field.
Date poison pill record was created in the editorial db.
Date on which a shareholder must own shares in order to receive the rights dividend.

i.l: Poison Pill Record Last Update Date
i.d: Date of most recent update to the poison pill record in the editorial db.
Date the issuer first released a statement announcing the adoption of the rights plan or amendment
Date the rights agreement between the issuer and the rights agent was executed
Date of shareholder vote on management's proposal to adopt the shareholder rights plan. Shareholder approval is required only for Canadian companies.
Date the rights plan was cancelled, the plan may have been redeemed prior to its expiration date, or, the company may have been acquired through a loop hole in the plan.
Shareholder Rights Plan Source Information Date

Source of Shareholder Rights Plan Information
